defines.description: Any symbols put here will be defined in the shader used for this state

samplerStates.description: This array defines all the sampler states to be used for this state. The available data only defines texture filtering, but there may be more that's possible and just isn't available

states.description: The renderer states that need to be active when rendring this state

depthBias.description: Offset the value written to the depth buffer

depthBiasOGL.description: Offset the value written to the depth buffer

slopeScaledDepthBiasOGL.description: Offset the value written to the depth buffer

vertexShader.description: Provides the filepath for the vertex shader to use for this state

vrGeometryShader.description: Provides the filepath for the VR geometry shader to use for this state

fragmentShader.description: Provides the filepath for the fragment shader to use for this pass

vertexFields.description: Declares what vertex data this state's shaders use, and what order the vertex attributes should be passed in

frontFace.description: Defines the stencil buffer attributes to use when rendering front faces

stencilFunc.description: What stencil function to use for the front faces in this state

stencilFailOp.description: What to do when the stencil test fails

stencilDepthFailOp.description: What to do when the stencil and depth tests fail (I think)

StencilPassOp.description: What to do when the stencil test passes

backFace.description: Defines the stencil buffer attributes to use when rendering back faces

stencilFunc.description: What stencil function to use for the back faces in this state

stencilFailOp.description: What to do when the stencil test fails

stencilDepthFailOp.description: What to do when the stencil and depth tests fail (I think)

StencilPassOp.description: What to do when the stencil test passes

stencilRef.description: Which stencil buffer to use (I think)

stencilReadMask.description: The mask to use when reading values from the stencil buffer

stencilMaskWrite.description: The mask to use when writing values to the stencil buffer

msaaSupport.description: Tells Bedrock how to handle MSAA for this rendering object

primitiveMode.description: Tells Bedrock what type of geometry should be rendered in this state. Triangle is the default value

blendSrc.description: How to interpret the source data when performing blending

blendDst.description: How to interpret the destination data when blending

textures.description: What textures this state needs enabled

alphaSrc.description: How the source alpha should be interpreted

alphaDst.description: Hoe the destination alpha should be interpreted

depthFunc.description: The depth function to use for this state

samplerIndex.description: The index of the sampler you want to set the state for

textureFilter.description: The type of texture filter to use for this sampler

textureWrap.description: What to do when the UV coordinates are greater than 1 or less than 0

field.description: Declares which vertex field this object refers to

textureLocation.description: Where this texture should come from. `InUserPackage` means it comes from a resourcepack, `Dynamic` means it's generated by Minecraft at runtime

textureName.description:
The name of the texture to use. This value can be a specific texture in a resourcepack (something like `textures/misc/enchanted_item_glint`), or it can refer to an atlas (like `atlas.terrain`). A couple atlases:

 * `atlas.terrain`: The atlas of all the block textures
 * `atlas.items`: The atlas of all the item textures

Some dynamic textures:

 * Brightness

 * SeasonFoliage
